title: Green Roofs: Long-Term Return on Sustainability Investment
summary: A cost–benefit review of CSULB’s proposed rooftop retrofits suggests break-even within seven years under current energy rates.
details: The model accounts for maintenance, plant replacement, and projected cooling savings based on NOAA climate data.
full:
Overview

Using case studies from comparable campuses, installation costs average $110 / sq ft with median lifespan of 40 years.

Key Findings

  • Energy savings: 18–22 % reduction in HVAC load.
  • Storm-water retention: up to 70 % annual rainfall capture.
  • Carbon offset equivalent: 95 metric tons CO₂ per year.

Conclusion

While upfront costs are high, avoided-energy and maintenance savings yield an IRR near 9 %. Strategic phasing by building type maximizes ROI.
